articles.author: Ashley Belanger
articles.title: Thousands of realistic but fake AI child sex images found online, report says
articles.description: Fake AI child sex images moving from dark web to social media, researcher says.
articles.content: 0 with Child safety experts are growing increasingly powerless to stop thousands of AIgenerated child sex images from being easily and rapidly created, then shared across dark web pedophile foru [+3152 chars]
articles.summary: Both law enforcement and child-safety experts report these AI images are increasingly being popularized on dark web pedophile forums, with many Internet users "wrongly" viewing this content as a legally gray alternative to trading illegal child sexual abuse materials (CSAM). Earlier this month, the FBI issued an alert, "warning the public of malicious actors creating synthetic content (commonly referred to as 'deepfakes') by manipulating benign photographs or videos to target victims," including reports of "minor children and non-consenting adults, whose photos or videos were altered into explicit content. The agency blamed recent technology advancements for the surge in malicious deepfakes because AI tools like Stable Diffusion, Midjourney, and DALL-E can be used to generate realistic images based on simple text prompts. But that technology only works to detect previously reported images, not newly AI-generated images. "These images aren't just spreading on the dark web, either, but on "social media, public forums, or pornographic websites," the FBI warned. There seems to be no precedent, however, as officials could not cite a single prior case resulting in federal charges, the Post reported.As authorities become more aware of the growing problem, the public is being warned to change online behaviors to prevent victimization. These advancements are "continuously improving the quality, customizability, and accessibility of artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled content creation," the FBI warned.
articles.html_summary:
• Both law enforcement and child-safety experts report these AI images are increasingly being popularized on dark web pedophile forums, with many Internet users "wrongly" viewing this content as a legally gray alternative to trading illegal child sexual abuse materials (CSAM).
  • Earlier this month, the FBI issued an alert, "warning the public of malicious actors creating synthetic content (commonly referred to as 'deepfakes') by manipulating benign photographs or videos to target victims," including reports of "minor children and non-consenting adults, whose photos or videos were altered into explicit content.
  • The agency blamed recent technology advancements for the surge in malicious deepfakes because AI tools like Stable Diffusion, Midjourney, and DALL-E can be used to generate realistic images based on simple text prompts.
  • But that technology only works to detect previously reported images, not newly AI-generated images.
  • "These images aren't just spreading on the dark web, either, but on "social media, public forums, or pornographic websites," the FBI warned.
  • There seems to be no precedent, however, as officials could not cite a single prior case resulting in federal charges, the Post reported.As authorities become more aware of the growing problem, the public is being warned to change online behaviors to prevent victimization.

articles.author: Kyle Orland
articles.title: Beyond missing Titanic sub, handheld gamepads are a common military interface
articles.description: US Army, NASA, and more piggyback off years of familiar game controller design.
articles.content: Enlarge/ Senior Airman Ryan Hoagland operates an explosive ordnance disposal robot using an Xbox 360 controller.15 with  This weekends tragic disappearance of an OceanGate Expeditions tourist su [+5074 chars]
articles.summary: "Military users presented with a familiar game controller "are far more willing to experiment, they are much less afraid of technology... it comes to them naturally," Israeli Colonel Udi Tzur told The Washington Post regarding a tank controlled with an Xbox controller. ""A lot of money gets invested into video game technologies so we can just piggyback on what they've done," NASA's Matt Clausen said at the 2012 Penny Arcade Expo.Handheld game controllers can also sometimes be more comfortable than the bulky, heavy-duty joysticks specially built for military devices. And in 2018, the USS Colorado attack submarine was handing Navy sailors an Xbox controller to operate its periscope-like photonic masts.Game controllers are also useful for remotely controlling complex military equipment in situations that could be unsafe for an on-site human pilot.  Kyle Orland - Jun 21, 2023 12:38 pm UTC MRI analysis firm BodyViz, for instance, told the BBC that an Xbox controller provided a much more intuitive way to rotate, pan, zoom or fly-through a patient's virtual anatomy than the previously standard mouse-and-keyboard interface. iRobot Director of North American Products Tom Phelps told Business Insider in 2013 that they found great success replacing their IED disposal robot's original "puck-like controller" with the more familiar design of a standard Xbox controller. And NASA has used an Xbox Kinect as an interface to control complex rovers like the six-limbed ATHLETE (All-Terrain Hex-Limbed Extra-Terrestrial Explorer).But international militaries have shown some of the most avid and continued interest in adapting game-control interfaces for decidedly non-entertainment uses. Shabtai told The Washington Post that the "lighter and more portable" game controllers could be held in a lap in a way that fixed, mounted controls could not.
articles.html_summary:
• "Military users presented with a familiar game controller "are far more willing to experiment, they are much less afraid of technology... it comes to them naturally," Israeli Colonel Udi Tzur told The Washington Post regarding a tank controlled with an Xbox controller.
  • ""A lot of money gets invested into video game technologies so we can just piggyback on what they've done," NASA's Matt Clausen said at the 2012 Penny Arcade Expo.Handheld game controllers can also sometimes be more comfortable than the bulky, heavy-duty joysticks specially built for military devices.
  • And in 2018, the USS Colorado attack submarine was handing Navy sailors an Xbox controller to operate its periscope-like photonic masts.Game controllers are also useful for remotely controlling complex military equipment in situations that could be unsafe for an on-site human pilot.
  • Kyle Orland - Jun 21, 2023 12:38 pm UTC MRI analysis firm BodyViz, for instance, told the BBC that an Xbox controller provided a much more intuitive way to “rotate, pan, zoom or fly-through a patient's virtual anatomy” than the previously standard mouse-and-keyboard interface.
  • iRobot Director of North American Products Tom Phelps told Business Insider in 2013 that they found great success replacing their IED disposal robot's original "puck-like controller" with the more familiar design of a standard Xbox controller.
  • And NASA has used an Xbox Kinect as an interface to control complex rovers like the six-limbed ATHLETE (All-Terrain Hex-Limbed Extra-Terrestrial Explorer).But international militaries have shown some of the most avid and continued interest in adapting game-control interfaces for decidedly non-entertainment uses.

articles.author: Benj Edwards
articles.title: Purely AIgenerated songs declared ineligible for Grammy Awards
articles.description: A work that contains no human authorship is not eligible in any categories.
articles.content: 3 with Amid increasing use of generative AI in music, the Recording Academy has updated its rules for the 66th annual Grammy Awards regarding the role of AI in considered works, Reuters reports. To [+4890 chars]
articles.summary: material incorporated into the work are not eligible to be nominees or GRAMMY recipients insofar as their contribution to the portion of the work that consists of such A.I material is concerned. De minimis is defined as lacking significance or importance; so minor as to merit disregard.As AI continues to emerge as a creative but controversial tool in the arts, the Grammy rule introduction serves as a notable statement about the importance of human creativity in the music industry. To be eligible for an award, a song must have meaningful human authorship. Purely algorithmically generated music cannot win a Grammy.According to the 66th Grammy Awards Rules & Guidelines booklet, works generated solely by AI are not eligible for the awards. The credit and potential for nomination or award receipt go to the human elements that significantly contribute to the song.AI in music can take different forms. Only human creators are eligible to be submitted for consideration for, nominated for, or win a GRAMMY Award. A work that contains no human authorship is not eligible in any Categories.
articles.html_summary:
• material incorporated into the work are not eligible to be nominees or GRAMMY recipients insofar as their contribution to the portion of the work that consists of such A.I material is concerned.
  • De minimis is defined as lacking significance or importance; so minor as to merit disregard.As AI continues to emerge as a creative but controversial tool in the arts, the Grammy rule introduction serves as a notable statement about the importance of human creativity in the music industry.
  • To be eligible for an award, a song must have meaningful human authorship.
  • Purely algorithmically generated music cannot win a Grammy.According to the 66th Grammy Awards Rules & Guidelines booklet, works generated solely by AI are not eligible for the awards.
  • The credit and potential for nomination or award receipt go to the human elements that significantly contribute to the song.AI in music can take different forms.
  • Only human creators are eligible to be submitted for consideration for, nominated for, or win a GRAMMY Award.

articles.author: Ron Amadeo
articles.title: Get your first look at the OnePlus V Fold, thanks to render leaks
articles.description: We were expecting an Oppostyle foldable, but this looks like a Samsung phone.
articles.content: Enlarge/ The OnePlus V Fold is in the style of a Samsung Foldable.2 with OnePlus is gearing up to release a foldable smartphone, and the reliable leaker, Steve Hemmerstoffer, AKA OnLeaks, has giv [+1896 chars]
articles.summary: I wonder if anything else is in that camera bump.OnePlus has chosen a center hole-punch camera in the front display and a top-left hole-punch camera on the inner display, ruling out any funky under-display camera technology. There's a side fingerprint reader and what looks like speakers on the top and bottom edges.This render shows a faux leather finish, but the Smartprix report says that "OnePlus may also introduce variants of the device that employ more traditional and premium materials such as metal or glass." Smartprix didn't publish exact dimensions, but it looks like a very slim device.The rear camera bump is a big circle, just like other recent OnePlus phones. The phone makes the curious decision to not put the LED flash in the camera bump, instead sticking it all the way in the upper-left corner of the phone. Isn't the purpose of a camera bump to make room for all that extra bulky camera hardware? Usually, these are based on CAD files that need to float around for accessory makers.OnePlus is a subsidiary of BBK, and the previous vague expectation was that OnePlus would end up shipping a rebrand of an existing BBK foldable, like the Oppo Find N2. As usual, one of the best parts of a OnePlus phone will be the charging situation, with the report promising a 4800 mAh battery with 100 W SuperVOOC charging.The phone should launch sometime in Q3.
articles.html_summary:
• I wonder if anything else is in that camera bump.OnePlus has chosen a center hole-punch camera in the front display and a top-left hole-punch camera on the inner display, ruling out any funky under-display camera technology.
  • There's a side fingerprint reader and what looks like speakers on the top and bottom edges.This render shows a faux leather finish, but the Smartprix report says that "OnePlus may also introduce variants of the device that employ more traditional and premium materials such as metal or glass."
  • Smartprix didn't publish exact dimensions, but it looks like a very slim device.The rear camera bump is a big circle, just like other recent OnePlus phones.
  • The phone makes the curious decision to not put the LED flash in the camera bump, instead sticking it all the way in the upper-left corner of the phone.
  • Isn't the purpose of a camera bump to make room for all that extra bulky camera hardware?
  • Usually, these are based on CAD files that need to float around for accessory makers.OnePlus is a subsidiary of BBK, and the previous vague expectation was that OnePlus would end up shipping a rebrand of an existing BBK foldable, like the Oppo Find N2.

articles.author: Ron Amadeo
articles.title: Googles $200 metal Pixel Watch band is very premium, very expensive
articles.description: Google chips away at the Pixel Watchs lack of band styles.
articles.content: 4 with  Its finally here, the metal Pixel Watch band.  The clasp has a lovely G logo engraved into it.  Bend the links 90 degrees and youll reveal the connecti [+4069 chars]
articles.summary: Google's other metal watch band style promised at launch, the "Metal Mesh Band," was supposed to launch in "Spring" alongside this link band, but the listing was removed from the Google Store in April. The traditional metal watch band hasn't been an option from Google until now.Google's initial lack of variety of watch bands was just one of the supply chain issues the company had with its first first-party smartwatch. Squeeze the tweezers, and you'll compress the spring bar, retracting the two pins and disconnecting the link from the watch band.Spring bars can often be fiddly since you usually have to compress them and then make them hit left and right holes in the watch band. The "Google Pixel Watch Metal Links Band" was briefly for sale on the Google Store Friday before being sold out.The band links have an interesting attachment mechanism. But on the Pixel Watch band, a small ramp is milled around each hole, which will handle the spring compression, and you can just click the band links together. Apple and Samsung understand the need for a smartwatch to look good and fit a user's style; Samsung has around a dozen styles of watch bands, and Apple offers a nearly limitless selection of bands from itself and licensed third-party designers like Nike and Herms. Part of what gives off the first-generation vibe is the Pixel Watch's lack of watch band variety.
articles.html_summary:
• Google's other metal watch band style promised at launch, the "Metal Mesh Band," was supposed to launch in "Spring" alongside this link band, but the listing was removed from the Google Store in April.
  • The traditional metal watch band hasn't been an option from Google until now.Google's initial lack of variety of watch bands was just one of the supply chain issues the company had with its first first-party smartwatch.
  • Squeeze the tweezers, and you'll compress the spring bar, retracting the two pins and disconnecting the link from the watch band.Spring bars can often be fiddly since you usually have to compress them and then make them hit left and right holes in the watch band.
  • The "Google Pixel Watch Metal Links Band" was briefly for sale on the Google Store Friday before being sold out.The band links have an interesting attachment mechanism.
  • But on the Pixel Watch band, a small ramp is milled around each hole, which will handle the spring compression, and you can just click the band links together.
  • Apple and Samsung understand the need for a smartwatch to look good and fit a user's style; Samsung has around a dozen styles of watch bands, and Apple offers a nearly limitless selection of bands from itself and licensed third-party designers like Nike and Hermès.

articles.author: By PATRICK WHITTLE and HOLLY RAMER - Associated Press
articles.title: The US Coast Guard is bringing in new ships and underwater vessels to search for lost submersible
articles.description: The US Coast Guard says it is bringing in new ships and underwater vessels to search for a submersible that vanished while bringing five people down to the wreck of the Titanic. But even those who expressed some optimism on

articles.summary: Rescuers on Wednesday rushed more ships and vessels to the area where a submersible disappeared on its way to the Titanic wreckage site, hoping underwater sounds they detected for a second straight day might help narrow their search in an increasingly urgent mission. He said a couple of spares are kept on board just in case.The search for the missing vessel has drawn international attention. The submersible had seven backup systems to return to the surface, including sandbags and lead pipes that drop off and an inflatable balloon.Lost aboard the vessel are pilot Stockton Rush, the CEO of the company leading the expedition. articles.author: By JOSH BOAK - Associated Press
articles.title: Biden discusses risks and promises of artificial intelligence with tech leaders in San Francisco
articles.description: President Joe Biden has convened a group of technology leaders in San Francisco to debate the risks and promises of artificial intelligence. The Biden administration is seeking to figure out how to regulate the emergent field of AI, looking for

On Tuesday, he told a group that he expects that John Kerry, the special envoy for climate, will soon return to China for talks on reducing carbon emissions.__Associated Press writer Barbara Ortutay in San Francisco contributed to this report. I think the American people need to have the confidence that were going to do what we say were going to do, he said. Top officials are meeting two to three times each week on this issue, in addition to the daily work of federal agencies. Biden met Tuesday at the Fairmont hotel in San Francisco with Tristan Harris, executive director of the Center for Human Technology; Jim Steyer, the CEO of Common Sense Media; and Joy Buolamwin, founder of the Algorithmic Justice League, among others. At his first fundraiser of the night, Biden spoke about what he saw as freedoms under siege, particularly for the LGBTQ community and with the overturning of abortion protections by the U.S. Supreme Court.

articles.author: AP
articles.title: China says Biden comments likening leader Xi to a dictator extremely absurd and irresponsible
articles.description: China has called comments by President Joe Biden referring to Chinese leader Xi Jinping as a dictator extremely absurd and irresponsible. The new clash of words comes just over a day after Secretary of State Antony Blinken concluded a visit
articles.content: BEIJING (AP) China on Wednesday called comments by President Joe Biden referring to Chinese leader Xi Jinping as a dictator extremely absurd and irresponsible.The new clash of words comes just over [+2785 chars]
articles.summary: WASHINGTON (AP)  President Joe Bidens remarks calling Chinese leader Xi Jinping a dictator and China a country with real economic difficulties drew fast condemnation from China on Wednesday, cracking open a new rift just after the two countries agreed to tentative steps to stabilize the relationship. He views Xi Jinping as a dictator, Glaser said.And hes not very good ... at differentiating what should be said in public and what should be said in private, Glaser said. The reason why Xi Jinping got very upset in terms of when I shot that balloon down with two box cars full of spy equipment is he didnt know it was there, Biden told the crowd. Mao also reiterated Chinas version of the balloon episode, saying the balloon was for meteorological research and had been accidentally blown off course. In Beijing, Foreign Ministry spokesperson Mao Ning condemned Bidens unusually pointed comments as extremely absurd and irresponsible.The clash of words comes after Secretary of State Antony Blinken concluded a visit to Beijing on Monday that sought to break the ice in a relationship that has hit a historical low. That was the great embarrassment for dictators, when they didnt know what happened.Biden also played down trade competition from China, which is the worlds second-biggest economy after the United States but struggling to emerge from COVID-era financial troubles. articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Camera review site DPReview finds a buyer, avoids shutdown by Amazon
articles.description: Camera review site DPReview finds a buyer, avoids shutdown by Amazonarstechnica.com
articles.content: 15 with Back in March, the editorinchief of the 25yearold, Amazonowned camera review site DPReview.com announced that the site would be closing in April. The site was the casualty of a round o [+2518 chars]
articles.summary: The deal had already closed as of yesterday, June 20.Everett's post says that "the site will continue to operate as it was before, with all editorial coverage and site features remaining the same, and all historical content accessible." Former site editor Gannon Burgett criticized Amazon in harsh terms on Twitter, excoriating the company for the uncertainty it created for DPReview's current and former employees and freelancers.  Andrew Cunningham - Jun 21, 2023 12:44 pm UTC Back in March, the editor-in-chief of the 25-year-old, Amazon-owned camera review site DPReview.com announced that the site would be closing in April. The availability of that historical content was a major concern for many readershigh-end cameras have a long shelf life, and DPReview was an important content repository for people trying to navigate the used camera market. "You figure this sort of stuff out before shutting down an entire division of your company, not in hindsight after weeks of backlash and leaving freelancers to scramble for new gigs as theyre told they wont have a job," wrote Burgett. But I know that for most of them, it wasnt clear what was happening for at least the first two or three months, which is incredibly unfair to employees who helped build the very resource youre about to turn around and sell. Im extremely glad for everyone who did stick around and still has a job.
articles.html_summary:
• The deal had already closed as of yesterday, June 20.Everett's post says that "the site will continue to operate as it was before, with all editorial coverage and site features remaining the same, and all historical content accessible."
  • Former site editor Gannon Burgett criticized Amazon in harsh terms on Twitter, excoriating the company for the uncertainty it created for DPReview's current and former employees and freelancers.

page_description: Latest news for today in 10 minutes. Thousands of realistic but fake AI child sex images found online, report says. Beyond missing Titanic sub, handheld gamepads are a common military interface. Purely AIgenerated songs declared ineligible for Grammy Awards. Get your first look at the OnePlus V Fold, thanks to render leaks. Googles $200 metal Pixel Watch band is very premium, very expensive. The US Coast Guard is bringing in new ships and underwater vessels to search for lost submersible. Biden discusses risks and promises of artificial intelligence with tech leaders in San Francisco. China says Biden comments likening leader Xi to a dictator extremely absurd and irresponsible. Camera review site DPReview finds a buyer, avoids shutdown by Amazon.
